Key Match Events: New Zealand chased down their target of 179 with 10 balls to spare thanks to an unbeaten 87 from Mark Chapman.
Pakistan made 178 for four with Shadab Khan top-scoring with 41, while Ish Sodhi took 2/25.
Tim Robinson and Tim Seifert put on 42 for the opening partnership.
Chapman and Dean Foxcroft put on 117 for the third wicket with Foxcroft scoring 31.
The game turned in New Zealand's favour in the 15th and 16th overs when they managed to score 40 runs off two of Pakistan's most experienced bowlers Shaheen Shah Afridi and Naseem Shah.
Chapman and James Neesham then got the tourists home with Chapman's 87 coming off 42 balls and included nine fours and four sixes.
Post-Match Reflections: Mark Chapman said, 'I think we know Pakistan have a great attack, 178 was a chase-able score, generally it's high scoring here.'
Chapman added, 'Debutants bowled some tough overs and Ish was outstanding.'
Chapman reflected, 'Yesterday it was slower and we lost wickets in clumps... you have 100 partnership, you give yourself a good chance to win.'
Chapman noted, 'The way Siefert and Robinson set it up, we had a platform and we just tried to keep up with the rate, we knew they have world class attack.'
